subject: Re: [junit] problem while running junit tests on rational XDE
msgSnippet: Hi, ... Why do you want to test java.lang code? Do you work with Sun? ... Wrong, that error comes from your java compiler, and it also gives the reason. ...
messageBody:
Hi,

> i am trying to run a junit test that is used to test the method
> Math.round() in java.lang.Math.
Why do you want to test java.lang code?
Do you work with Sun?

> But the tool gives a compilation error .
Wrong, that error comes from your java compiler, and it also
gives the reason.

> I would like to point out that i have run this test successfully
> on the command prompt using jdk1.5.0.
Right. And now you try to compile it on a compiler older than
JDK 1.5.
Look at your code. You have a Java problem, not a JUnit problem.

First hint: autoboxing.
Second hint: Float and float.

Good luck,

Robert

--
